thread.title: Supreme Court dismisses Nick Salat poll case
thread.title_full: Supreme Court dismisses Nick Salat poll case

title: Supreme Court dismisses Nick Salat poll case
text:
Monday, October 19, 2015 Supreme Court dismisses Nick Salat poll case Mr Nick Salat. The Supreme Court on October 19, 2015 dismissed his petition challenging the election of Bomet Senator Wilfred Lesan. FILE PHOTO | NATION MEDIA GROUP NATION MEDIA GROUP In Summary Mr Salat lost the election petition at the High Court and moved to the Court of Appeal, which also dismissed his case. Prof Lesan was declared the winner after garnering 115,931 votes. Mr Salat had garnered 98,036 votes. Advertisement More by this Author 
The Supreme Court has dismissed an appeal in which Mr Nick Salat was challenging the election of Bomet Senator Wilfred Lesan. 
Mr Salat now faces a bill of over Sh60 million after the Supreme Court directed that he bear the costs of the proceedings. 
The Supreme Court upheld a Court of Appeal decision that had dismissed an appeal by Mr Salat. 
Mr Salat had lost the election petition at the High Court before moving to the Court of Appeal, which also dismissed his case. 
At the Court of Appeal, the politician had claimed that there were “massive irregularities” that he claimed were unearthed during the scrutiny of votes. 
He said the High Court judge who dismissed his petition disregarded “cogent evidence tendered by his witnesses to prove electoral malpractices marred voting and counting”. 
Mr Salat further stated that he was denied votes in most of his strongholds that were dubiously transferred to his opponent. 
Prof Lesan was declared the winner after garnering 115,931 votes. Mr Salat had garnered 98,036 votes.
